8jMflJjBTwVUBndp2e1Tgw.text: The food here is amazing the fish is fresh and it is never bad.  Its absolutely phenomenal and truly award winning

AEjAEOrOpQVwMS47HxL9IA.text: The fish was fresh and fairly good, but the batter was very bland, and the chips had no flavor at all. The entire meal was less than stellar to be quite honest, and the service wasn't great either. Plus, two pieces of fish, some fries, and a coke simply don't merit the £31 bill (about $50 USD). The atmosphere was nice, and they seat you fairly quickly if you have a reservation, but overall, not impressed with the food or the price.

kF1up_QwmoQDp2rW4lERug.text: The haddock and chips is excellent. They have a take-out option that comes in a well-designed basket. There's also benches right in front of the restaurant, where you can sit and eat, and watch the interesting flow of traffic and people --- which I much enjoyed.

qEl8y85SYW_uSdPgA1Vb9A.text: Go on a weekend. Live band upstairs, never seen a restaurant with so much life. customers were getting up and dancing, music was cool. staff look great in old style uniforms. everyone goes on about east london all the time, camden is where its at now. even pizza east brand is in nw london now!love the jukebox downstairs must be a camden thing as salon sin hairdressers round the corner has one too!

D1pv-ZZeT0NMzJbx-rXWpw.text: First visit. Waitresses in 50's casual attire and and head scarves (think Lucy, 1954) Cooks in fedoras ( see photo) We had classic haddoc and cod: Great fish, nongreasy, Huge portion chips, fine mushy peas. Attentive service. Rocking bebop / do-whop music, not too loud to converse. Worth your time.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Poppies Cooks

cSrukt39_NE71yfUHCLdzQ.text: Poppies has a very nice vintage interior design that is diner style with nice wall art, which is fun to dine in. The ambiance is casual/semi-formal and the waiters and waitresses wore cute holiday costumes during the holiday season. The waitresses were not the friendliest people, and did forget about my table of 5 people, but all of our fish and chips came out of the kitchen rather quickly and they were all very delicious! I tried both the haddock and the cod with chips and in my opinion the cod had a creamier taste. The haddock was good if you would like your fish to be more fried. The portion size, if the photo is not zoomed in, looks rather small on camera, but was able to fill everyone up at the end of the meal. It's good that Poppies provides salt and pepper for people to individually season their fish because a few of my friends thought Poppies tasted rather bland. No wifi, a little pricy for fish and chips, but overall worth the go because their fish and chips did taste delicious, and the food comes out nice and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Poppies haddock and chips

y4Kg9Dxs_6f2__oQqWXmLA.text: I've been here twice and both times that haven't had haddock. The woman at the counter tried to push cod on me, seemingly unaware of sustainability issues (whereas a lot of places serving cod will emphasise it's been sourced sustainably, which may be a dubious claim but at least they acknowledge the issue). She was also just generally quite grumpy and unhelpful. The meal I just finished was bland beyond words, despite salt and vinegar. It must have been chronically underseasoned. The mouthfeel was OK (sounds weird but important in fish and chips) and the price was OK (£6.50 for plaice and medium chips). But that's about it.

jNIsU_eevqOzLvuZSvSFnw.text: The staff are very welcoming and I was seated right away.I order The Sausage and chips as I am not a big fish fan. The chips where nice, but I have had better in terms of chips,  the price was fair for the quality of the food. The sausages where nice and it was all fresh. Only issue I see his the music is rather loud.  But good non the less.

tJhpMR_3p2ZpfwkNHjNOcQ.text: Respectable cod and chips but Expensive! Ruined, completely, by the Johnny Rockets atmosphere, totally off putting. Avoid, my fellow Americans. Avoid.

JistaGC4yIVWkmlfrJpeWQ.text: Best FishChips ever ! I discovered this place just by walking into Camden Town and because I was hungry. And it is a come back to the 50's. The music (with a band upstairs), the waiter/waitress and everything else come from "*Grease" movie lol !Maybe it is more expansive than other place, but you have a big piece of fish. It is a little bit too long to have your dish, but only because it is cooking on place and fresh of course. Downstairs you can see the cooks working. You also have a few kind of fish, and other kind of meal. Great things if you want to go with friends who don't like fish.

r4CE09h4zurrRo6_KKxnEQ.text: Nice venue with a 50's vibe, friendly staff keen to seat and attend to your needs, but let down by the food (in my opinion) and the price.It aggrieves me to know that many visitors to our shores will come to this place for an authentic experience. The option of newspaper with your food may be the closest they  get. For my £20 plus optional 12.5% service charge I had (sit down) Large Haddock, chips, mushy peas, bread and butter and a cup of tea.Haddock, nice enough "batter", but fish overcooked in my opinion, almost to the point of having the same texture as chicken breast. An un-PC as it may sound, not oily enough but obviously "healthier".  Chips, uniformly squared edges, harrumph.  The cardinal sin when serving fish and chips is NO SCRAPS., the tiny, crispy, bobbles of cooked batter that fall off the fish into the fryer. It was enjoyable, but I left really, really disappointed.  I expect I really just wanted to be in Bridlington or Filey on the east Yorkshire cost, but that was not their fault. For the price most people might prefer to go elsewhere.PS - What really brought a smile to my face, being British and of a certain age, what the single Fruit Salad and Black Jack chews with the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. As if you don't know what to do.
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Haddock "Fish Supper" and trimmings.
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Poppies - Camden

6dkMTBg43RqrwuuV2j9oxQ.text: So happy I finally got to go here! It's been on my list for a while. We got take out as there was a line outside to dine in! Really reasonable prices, which I was surprised at. Chips were great! Would definitely come back :)

4r4H3QQj-uALu9-Qo9eWpQ.text: Poppies fish and chips are some of the best in London. A few months ago, I got the cod and a side of chips and it was so freakin' good. I ordered a cod with chips and it exceeded my expectations. - the batter was perfectly crispy while not being too oily. - the cod was also excellent - soft and moist- the chips were thick and not greasy (with some malt vinegar on top...oh my)Although Poppies is quite pricey, if your visiting London and want some great fish and chips look no further.

_uO3pATA-mQpBqv4syRstQ.text: Probably one of the hidden gems of Camden Town. Some of the best fish and chips in town. Put it on your must visit liar even though it's a little pricey.

GNzbvELDBSphWnv4Uode0Q.text: I have been craving Fish and chips for a long time!!! I live in the Camden area and always thought that the place lacked a true "British" fish and chip shop. So when I found out about Poppies I couldn't wait to get in there. The venue looks the part and I like the small attention to detail. Waitresses were very keen to serve, but I couldn't help but think that this was because they must have had twice the amount required! We were attended to by at least 3 different people, all keen to be doing anything other than standing about looking pretty. The fish and chips can't really be faulted; the fish was fresh and the batter light. The chips were chunky and not at all soggy.  The food was served in a timely manner (as you would expect for fish and chips!). Portions were adequate, but I am used to finding a decent portion of chips a challenge so in truth I would have wanted more on the plate)My main issue with Poppies is the price!!! We ended up with a bill of £30(ish)..... For fish and chips!!! My local chippy in Hampshire has me smiling and content for under a £10 so why I need to pay three times the amount for the pleasure of the same meal in Camden I am unsure. Recommend it if you need your FnC fix, but in honesty as is the current fad in London... traditional foods shouldn't be over priced just because you package the venue a bit nicer.

DwE33UoQRUTSZM7rJAtIWw.text: The live band was the best thing this place had going.Few of the waitresses spoke English well.The fish honestly left my stomach very upset and that is a review I don't like to leave, especially since it came recommended by the person we were staying with.Fun atmosphere. Vibrant. But I'm just not sure I would return to eat the fish.......Chips were tasty to me though..

VqXKOkYogizf6-4IvbMxQw.text: What's a trip to london without eating Fish 'n chips! Both the cod and fries ahem chips were fresh and crunch while still having substance with each bite. I guess for the time that we waited it better. Not a fan of the mushy peas so sue me, still think it's kinda cool that the national dish of this place is served by poppies that is reminiscent of a 50's diner in the USA

uqviCU8pBgGOq4twFWBfBw.text: This place is amazing! Came here on a week night with a friend and it was relatively empty, though we noticed a lot of people getting take away. The decor was cute and the outfits that the waitresses wear really kept with the theme. For appetizer we got CALAMARI RINGS and they were amazing! The best calamari rings I'VE EVER HAD! For main we got the CHICKEN PIE and it was decent, a very standard English pie. Looking back I wish we had ordered the fish n' chips, considering they claim to be #1 and finally for dessert we got the STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING and again IT WAS INCREDIBLE! Wanted to order another one because it was too goodThe wait staff here is extremely friendly and made us feel very welcome coming all the way from America. It was a tad pricey for an American student budget but pretty standard for a London restaurant. I would recommend this to all my friends who want a bite to eat in the Camden area.

fHt8Uxw5FUh1tAQ99z9gEQ.text: Best fish and chips. It's a big piece of fried fish. I also got the smushy peas on the side omg so good didn't know this is British thing, yum!

xqhlnll3UT9WtMOjuJZK4Q.text: My first and only FnC experience in London so I don't have much to compare it with. I thought it was very good, though maybe a bit on the pricey side. It's cheaper and quicker if you go to the takeout section through the side door, and there are seats outside for takeout customers. A lot of the reviews of this place are about the decor and atmosphere, but since I only had takeout this review will be strictly for the food. I had the haddock; my fiancee had the cod. Both were excellently prepared and cooked perfectly. I personally wasn't a huge fan of the chips as I'm more used to crispy french fries, but my fiancee seemed to like them. I also tried the battered sausage...skip that. Stick with fish. Overall this is a really nice place to just stop by for a quick bite while exploring Camden Market...but save some room for the food booths in Camden Lock area

2XsaYeFBH7oRFZo3jVaiwQ.text: Consistently excellent fish and chips. I've visited this place about 20 times in the last two years, and had great food and service every time. Be interesting to see how their outpost in the market does.

4MQQ_Im7YrsQUpgW8nYWZA.text: Ordered the Cod Regular Fish and Chips for 11.7 quid. 50s diner feel. Waitresses with cute aprons, slicked back gentlemen behind the bar. The fish itself wasn't extraordinary so I was a bit disappointed. I did like that the dish came with tartar sauce and ketchup in cute little jam jars, but otherwise given the price, I wasn't at all impressed. Perhaps the Pappy's at Spitalfields is better?

Tv-uI1DRq-wx-3hbyRHZbw.text: They claim to have won the best fish and chips since 2014, but honestly I went there and was seriously underwhelmed. They draw you in with multiple signs posted all over Camden. Three friends and I ordered the regular fish and chips. The fish lacked flavor and the chips lacked salt. It was very bland and overhyped. I would not go back and not recommend. you can definitely find better, more reasonably price fish and chips anywhere in London, in fact I have better in America. Major tourist trap.

pXzHd9HUfY_d5Sn8otWziA.text: Poppies fish and chip bar is OK.  It's expensive if you eat in so I took take away.  I liked the fish and chips but the large cod was a bit small.  I like this food but more would be good.

K_VLx5zRhZaDLuxaHjV-SQ.text: What a let down. I made Poppies the first stop after arriving in London. I had it bookmarked and on my itinerary to make it to Poppies once I stepped foot in London. With all the hype and awards, I was totally expecting some spectacular! You know what's coming up next. I arrived and it had barely opened so it was pretty empty. Made my way upstairs and was seated. Essentially it's just fried fish or other fried seafood and chips (fries for us in the States). We asked the waitress for suggestions and portion sizes decided on the larger sizes and different types of fish. We also ordered an assortment of drinks, one of which was really good was the ginger beer. I love ginger beer and this was actually really good and I would order it again.As for the actual fish and chips dishes, the large portion was way larger than the waitress told us. Great that we got more food but we could've done without ordering two orders which meant we were left with a ton of leftover fish and chips. Regardless of which type of fish we chose, the flavor was about the same. I say it was a bit bland and more breaded that I had hoped. The chips were fluffy and decent but way too many spuds for my liking. We also got an order of the Chicken Pie which is pretty much a Chicken Pot Pie with chips on the side as well. A lot smaller than expected and about the same price as the huge plates of fish...I don't know why...The pie was also not hot enough and wasn't very flavorful as well.Coming back to the service. The waitress first told us the portions were a lot smaller than they actually were. Next, they were not very attentive throughout our meal and did not come by to ask how things were. They did clean up the table very quickly but that was it. In terms of the check, they were also quick with that... I wonder why. Service as a whole was mediocre.I was utterly disappointed at Poppies. They are supposed to be award winning but I felt that there must be other places that had better fish and chips and better service. Sadly, we left the restaurant super full, with empty pockets because the plates were relatively expensive, and wishing we had the little stalls of street food nearby instead...

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod Fish and Chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Chicken pie

3noEHpyOb3jcqBfuFWTYFQ.text: I was visiting a friend and she took me to this place for fish and chips. It was my first time visiting London and I knew I had to venture out to find some fish and chips. When we arrived, there was no wait for a table and there was plenty of seating. I ordered the large fish (cod) and chips with a side of mushy peas. I was told that the mushy peas is also a local classic with fish and chips. The fried fish was huge!!! I loved the sauce that came with the fish and the portions were large. Yum...delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips!

9CGJi63ireXyY8Bw1QPv8g.text: The best fish and chips we have had in London -- hands down! The vintage vibe here is cool and fun too.They serve 2 kinds of fish here, haddock and the traditional cod. Both are sourced sustainably, but to my taste the haddock was more flavourful and delicious.Both cod and haddock were fried perfectly in a light crispy batter and served piping hot. Mushy peas were better than most, but we would he likes some mint in them for a bit of zing. We think Poppies compared very favorably to The Golden Hind, but the superior flavour of the haddock at Poppies nipped the old Marylebone High Street institution.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. For this Texan marooned in the land of nonspicy British food -- SALVATION!!!
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. The check comes with vintage 1940s-style candies in a fry basket
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish cakes -

Yaj1CO7j9XZNUhR1x0EQGQ.text: Great fish and chips. Live music. Great wait staff! Clean not cramped dining area. Vegetable pasty was also good.

oyc0r5M0gjzUZMVRIz4uOw.text: The place to go for nice ( a bit pricy) fish and chips in London! The "after war" atmosphere with retro music in the restaurant is really nice and makes it unique. The food itself is ok, good and fat obviously. It's a nice place to go if you're around Camden town

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chips and lemon sole one

2o-1GGiGOBoRmS2YBxQcyA.text: The place was packed but we managed to get a table for 4. Loved the fish & chips, mashed peas and beer! One of the best fish & chips we have had. Staff were very friendly and made us feel at home. Great place for a meal after shopping at Camden Town.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips.

Ni3TdUXMNRE8MhxqZOCAZA.text: Fish and chips were good. Lots of tourists (so expect a big crowd )and a bit overpriced, but worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Peas
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

kGqy6p2f-5rGC17tVpYEqg.text: Excellent classic Cod-fish.the chips were okay.But the Fish was INCREDIBLE.Good portions. If you are super hungry - this will do the trick.If you are not super hungry - you can share a plate as a snack :D

_zzkItKmOHaeKu1QROpPIA.text: We got the large cod and chips, which we later discovered was almost twice as expensive than if we had gotten takeaway. That was a disappointing start to our meal.The fish was delicious and not dry, and the chips were thick cut and tasty (needed salt). I wouldn't say it's the best fish & chips I've ever had, but they were certainly better than the others we got at Borough Market.

V7ZMG7oLCnbfk0BwgDAYRA.text: So glad I got to try Poppies during my visit to London.  Tried the cod fish and chips and the fish was so juiced and the chips just hit the spot.  We also tried the toffee sticky pudding... Definitely with getting.  Next time I'm in London I'm coming again!

jqx8H9lQxf0XVCAxd38Qtg.text: So when in London, you must have fish and chips..Right!??My friends and family recommended this place and it did not disappoint. Several locations in London, we wanted to try it out here.  Large restaurant, servers are friendly and uniforms are super cute.  I ordered cod and chips and a side of mashy peas.  It was nice, the fish was cooked well not too greasy, fish was nice and flakey, and the batter was just right not too thick or thin.  The chip were also nice went well with the fish.  The mashy peas was ok, was never a fan but it was nice to have some type of green with the meal.  I'm pretty sure London has millions of fish and chips places, Im glad we tried this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

JqmUmN4defWVswKPHHQCGw.text: While vacationing in London, met up with a friend at Poppies for some good fish and chips!  Definitely did not disappoint!  Portions are big, chips are yummy and fish is definitely delicious!  Mind you this was my only experience of fish and chips in London, but it was a great one!I just ordered the basic cod fish and chips for 13-15£ (can't remember exactly...) and a cream soda.  The breeding on the fish was great because it didn't flake off nor was it greasy.  The fish was cooked perfectly as I tend to find fish and chips at other places tend to over cook the fish and it can become dry.The best part that earned the 5 stars was the free entertainment on Friday night! What a great band singing oldies!  Fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Had the cod and chips
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Live band was amazing! Really entertaining.

FtbJaHlQqrgJlwZbuI2a8w.text: This place is about more than fish and chips. I was in a bind and they took me in, helped me out, saw me on my way and did it all with a smile. It's a classic spot in Camden run by people that deserve eternal patronage.May their fish and chips live in forever and may the people who run this joint all be blessed. Long live Poppies!!!

kSZQDtpQdzfT8Kqjw6gOHg.text: Again they ran out of large Cod on Saturday and told us they would have more on Sunday.  They should know by now to order more at the weekends.  So we went back at Sunday lunch time.  I don't know where they got fish from on Sunday.  The place was busy, but the Large Cod was not large at all.  It was mushy and the batter peeled off within a minute. The Chips were pale and very greasy.  Maybe we should avoid here at the weekends.

vmwjtOvYtrJwrSPdgXNixw.text: I had the r hilarious size cod fish and chips, and the portion was HUGE. I can't imagine the large portion. The fish is worth the hype. Yummy!

G-ZTOkaSErJDz8Tl_a_9_Q.text: So good! The cod was delightfully light and the chips were super hearty. The haddock was also light but very rich and flavorful. The chicken was also good although not nearly as delicious as the fish. The sticky toffee pudding was VERY sweet but came with a dollop of vanilla ice cream. Definitely recommend their haddock and chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. haddock and chips

_qCOp1vx5fwYQiaqVJYzQQ.text: Expect to see a lot of tourists here because apparently it's in almost every other guidebook to exploring London. In a place where a British staple like fish and chips is ubiquitous, Poppies stands out because it is such a consistent, straightforward place. I wouldn't say that the fish and chips here is mind-blowing, but it is good when you need a fix. Also, the waiters and waitresses are all in these super cute uniforms - and they also provide attentive service even though this place gets crowded quick. Solid place.

NFRcosFqsMHsOd6n1M9AoQ.text: I wanna start this review by saying this wasn't my first time here and to be fair, the fish & chips were great... Until I bit into a chip and found two sharp pieces of glass. After bleeding and showing the waiter the bits of glass I couldn't of course eat more, scared that it would happen again so I asked for the bill. To my surprise, we were charged for the whole thing and when I said it didn't seem very fair that I was being charged for that portion of fish & chips, a different waitress said she could give me a discount. Now, explain to me how giving me a discount on a regular fish & chip meal (£12) pays for the damage done to the inside of my mouth. So after saying this they took off one of the meals from the bill but I don't understand how it is possible that a restaurant with such a good rating that claims to be "the best fish & chip restaurant in the country" serves chips with glass in them and doesn't take responsibility for it. I can assure you I won't be coming back and I will never recommend this place to anyone.

4slm-zaB_dDICK_rUIeB7g.text: Until now I would have said there's normal fish (etc) & chips or there's bad but I would never have said it's great. In fact, generally when I go to a fish & chip restaurant I go for the seafood platter so that most of the food isn't covered in batter. At Poppies I was concerned because their seafood platter was all in batter - what would I eat? In the end I went for the scampi (which comes in batter rather than the breadcrumbs I am used to) and hoped it would be ok. I was I have to say very pleasantly surprised. The batter on the scampi was light and crispy, reminiscent of tempura batter and the chips were delicious. The only downside is that if you want peas or salad you have to buy those as extras making the already a little pricy cost even higher. All in all though a very enjoyable meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

N7AirrkLNcJStWEf6wgrhQ.text: Overpriced.Overcrowded. Underdone.Tourist trap.Unless I'm wrong and wet and slimy is how fish and chips is supposed to be done here in London...But I think they rushed my order and undercooked the fish, I could hear them shouting my table number in the back.I expressed my concern about the wet fish and the waitress just said cod is supposed to be that way, I should have ordered haddock. If my satisfaction was their concern they could have offered a little haddock for me to try. 15 pounds is a lot to spend on something you can't even finish. (Not for lack of trying to force it down--I was hungry!)Calamari was gross too.

7mkPH7x66Q0FpSNXdAWZQA.text: - Cute decorations- Server was friendly but a bit slow (but then again we were super hangry)- Both the haddock and cod fish and chips were super good--flaky and not too oily! - A bit pricey but the portions were large (and what can ya do it's London)

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and cod fish and chips

pFBRz9nbHgy42jfS7zNgig.text: Really not sure how this place has 4 stars. It's just your average fish and chips, nothing beyond. The chips weren't very cripsy and the fish was just okay, there was no seasoning or anything..The little bottles of ketchup and tartar sauce were way to small and made it extremely hard to dip into.The mushy peas weren't great in my opinion, but I'm not a big fan of mushy things to begin with. My boyfriend is a fan of mushy peas and he mentioned that he's had better elsewhere.Service here was decent and our waitress was prompt in taking orders, and getting the bill even though it was pretty full.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

-zEt2sj6nDejU_O5rJ1J2Q.text: One of the best fish and chips I had during my recent trip to London. We liked it so much that we ate ate there twice in a week! Fish was consistently fresh only downside was that the restaurant was always packed and there was always long lines for pick up!

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

z7q7PA5FgSUijI2tsGZsaA.text: I had to get my fish and chips fix while I was in London. I was going to be in Camden Town that day and Poppies was heavily advertised so why not. Even at 2pm on a weekday, it was pretty busy but I luckily got a spot because I was by myself.I got the cod and it came with a ton of chips (fries). The cod was nicely fried with a crispy outside and a flaky, tender inside. My only complaint was that there was absolutely no seasoning, not even salt. I guess that's what the condiments were for. The fries were pretty good but they weren't as crispy on the outside as I would hoped, but really fluffy inside. Overall, I had to season everything myself but it was a pretty well made meal and would recommend the fish!

wQFIt33SDhb0KqEpCRxUcg.text: We came here on our last day in London so my husband could get one last fix of fish and chips. My husband thought this was the best fish and chips he had while we were in London! I got the 1/2 chicken meal which was really juicy and tender, the fries are perfectly crispy on the outside and really soft on the inside. I would highly recommend checking this place out while you are in town!

CJiTdCdquwy0j_aKrncr2A.text: Coming from New England, I've had my fair share of fish and chips. So when I tried these, I was surprised how different the test was. The chips were completely different as in they were really like fries but they were delicious! The fish on the other hand, was perfectly fried and tasted pretty good. The only thing I would say is they did not give enough condiments to put on the fish and chips

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

41-j5AGjfe__mWDYaAI-HA.text: Tourist trap! And we fell for it... This was our first fish and chips experience in London. Since it was advertised as THE place for fish and chips we came by for dinner. We sat upstairs and that night they had live music. It was too loud for me but others seemed to enjoy it.We ordered a large haddock and chips, gherkin, and a beer each (the selection is really sad but we gave it a shot and it was not good). The food was alright, but nothing to write home about. If you do decide to try it, order take-away which costs ~50% less.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Malt vinegar - must for chips (and we like it on our fish)
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. (2) flavorless beers
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Large Haddock & Chips, side of Gherkin

gkuQaimG6XjQTFRwA26DMA.text: Based on Yelp review had lunch here. Shared the halibut fish and chips. Delicious. I must state the best fish and chips I've had in the UK. Try the Camden Pale Ale. Recommend if in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

LxhXxe39rwG_Wglj2tqcQA.text: I finally got to try the traditional cod bites and chips kid's lunch (£4.95) from @poppysfishandchips which is located in Camden Town! It is right near Camden Town tube station which is on the Northern Line. The location of Poppies may somewhat seem hidden, but the signs that it has put on the streets definitely helped me navigate towards the restaurant. On to the food... Even though I only got the kid's lunch, I still thought the portion of this meal was just right for me. I actually wonder how big the regular sized one is if this one filled me up! The cod fish was nicely cooked with a crunchy coat. This restaurant even served its fries with a homemade ketchup sauce! It is super delicious and definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

LuI3jOOloK4j5ITI9nZBJw.text: Poppies completely fulfilled my London fish and chips experience! Poppies had come recommend by a local, while we where shopping in Harrods the sales associate mentioned if we'd eaten poppies yet, we said no we'd eaten at another place and we mentioned the name and she seemed to be unimpressed and said try poppies! So we did! We weren't very hungry but our prior experience with London fish and chips left us bitter as a lemon, soooo.... not very hungry but in need of a authentic London bucket list dinner, off we went! We are so glad we did! The service was excellent, great ambience a pub type feel (what I anticipated) food fish and chips we excellent mushy peas we great! Loved the beer as well was a mini mug lager, and you must save room for dessert the sticky toffee pudding is a must have! Fried fish was delicious, hot crispy and the batter was excellent came with French fries( chips) again hot and delicious, we had the cod and tried the haddock, haddock was great as well, mushy peas was delicious, I must admit I didn't know what to expect with the mushy peas however it was delicious and a perfect side for your fish and chips, it was almost like a split pea soup except the thinner consistency. Have a mini lager superb with your meal! Mind you we were NOT very hungry at all when we went, but we could not resist dessert traditional sticky toffee pudding was on our menu! We were so happy we tried it! Delicious. Over all I guess you can tell we loved poppies and the traditional London vibe. Poppies is a must due when in London, and don't worry about the cab cost, cause it is a bit of a distance when your in the typical tourist area, it's totally worth it!

bKh7BTi7u6o53bH-DKDq0g.text: For how many people claim that Poppies serves the best fish & chips in town, my experience here was underwhelming. Although the fish did taste fresh, I thought that it could have used an extra kick in flavor - either with more seasoning or a dip. I'm used to having this dish with a side of tartar sauce, so the lack of it really emphasized the blandness. Meanwhile, the thick-cut chips became soggy from the vinegar that was drizzled on. They didn't have that addicting crunch you get from Mickey D's French fries.ProTip: Order take-out to avoid paying nearly double the price for your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Regular Fried Cod (6.50), Regular Chips (2.00)

LKRv8D1tHXi1h32hEmrPjQ.text: We ordered the regular cod without chips at the take-out stand. Firstly, the person assisting was impatient. Then someone else came in to get the regular cod with fries. About 7 minutes in, he starts to complain and gets his order. Fast forward 25 minutes and we still haven't gotten our food or an apology. When all was said and done we weren't offered any sort of compensation. Disappointed service. (The fish wasn't all that good either)

EDtvh9anYn4LvSBUNc7I9Q.text: Felt it was a bit overpriced, but maybe we pay for the live music as well. Fish was cooked nicely but didn't like the fries as much. Overall liked the food.

z_cPq38M4pFxIDbWjGBO_Q.text: My cousin told us to try fish and chips at Camden Market so we ended up at the Poppies outpost there yesterday. After seeing they had the best fish and chips in London three years ago we simply couldn't say no! I went with the bites and chips and my husband had the cod and chips. Both were delicious and I thought the bites were an awesome deal! I usually not a fan of what we call "steak fries" back home but Poppies does this type of fry quite well! While it's a chain I think Poppies is definitely worth a visit if you're searching for the perfect fish and chips while visiting London!

NzTPNQfFjLzkd-qQ2LzLyQ.text: "The cod fish & chips were meaty! It was one large piece with a plate full of chips. The employees were nice, and they were accomodating to my friend's peanut allergy. They fry their fish in peanut oil, so unfortunately she did have any. The waiters recommended a grilled fish that my friend loved. We also shared the steak pie with a side of mushy peas. The pie was great! I really liked the sauce that was in there. The mushy peas do not look appetizing, but it tasted good. The restaurant is rather large, and contained a full bar. They also had live music the night we were there, which was a Thursday night."

vaxrHs2oC0frI7keUdhZdA.text: Fish wise, its as fresh as it gets.  The cod just flakes off and almost melts in your mouth.  They are usually cooked to order but I am unsure if they still do it now as sometimes when I pass by the takeaway, I can see cooked fish sitting there in the counter.  That said it is still fresh.  The establishment lost in its batter.  Its too thin and didn't have that thick, juicy, oily, batter crunch.  I think I wouldn't mind coming here for fresh fish, but if I really have to choose after tasting a few of the best fish and chips in London, I would go to Mayfair Chippy.

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom

zqJO9HcVmJBuEG3r_FyyVg.text: My girlfriend and I are in visiting We wanted to eat some fish and chips late at night and found this place has the kitchen open till midnight so We decided to give it a shot.Disappointment after disappointment, first off we get there and the lady says only take away is open , no biggy we can order it Togo. Second, when we ordered I wanted to try the curry sauce to go with the fish, the lady said they ran out. Third , once we got our order I asked if I could have some ketchup Togo for the chips, cost extra per packet... who does that... fourth, once we made it back to our hostel to enjoy our warm meal, but not only did we not have ketchup but no tartar sauce or mayonnaise in our Togo order?Needless to say My gf and I had the driest meal and the saddest meal in our stay in London. Won't be going back , we should've just waited till the next day to eat and ate at Hook instead where I know they have better fish and sauce.

T4RiKw1SU3g33nbua04iEg.text: The restaurant features lots of retro and vintage posters and items, so it was an interesting theme for a fish and chip shop. The fish and chips were good, but a tad pricey. (It is a large portion and not dry). Mainly lots of tourists will be onsite, as it's near the Camden Stables Market. As we sat upstairs, the staff don't come up as often, so the service are slower if you are sitting upstairs, and they might be a communication issue on the status of your food and drinks. However, after chatting with some of the locals, they like Poppies as well...

TAUHgaCMuCBfHYz62gaEPA.text: I love to eat and I am a true foodie tourist in every sense of the word, but I'm sorry to say that Poppies let me down. I had been looking forward to trying it (and added it to my self-guided foodie tour of London), but it turned out to be not much more than a disappointment. The atmosphere is boisterous (loud 50s music) and the employees are friendly. We chose to takeaway our order and sat outside the restaurant on the benches provided. The volume of the music isn't the issue. Even the prices are fair (for London) and the portions are more than adequate. My fish and chips both tasted fresh. So what's the issue? It's the cooking technique. Our fish was so overcooked that it had an almost rubbery texture. It wasn't inedible but it wasn't great (and a fish and chips stand should know the appropriate amount of time to cook their fish). The chips were obviously fresh but they lacked any sort of satisfying crispy crunch. I didn't flat out hate this meal but it certainly isn't something I'd go out of my way to return to or to recommend to anyone else. I think the word that sums this place up best is "overhyped."

photos.caption: Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Small order of fish and chips. The batter was nice and crisp but the chips were not.
Photo of Poppies - London, United Kingdom. Fish looks flaky but it was very overcooked. Disappointing. I expected more from Poppies.

B7u7I79h75gO-jpUMBI98Q.text: While the uniforms and vibe is a little silly the food is quite good. I went for the Haddock fish and chips and was not dissatisfied. The chips and fish were textbook good. I was not really into the little jars of tarter sauce. I love tarter sauce and would prefer it if they served it in dishes. Other than this minor annoying thing the staff were all very attentive, the food came quickly, and I was taken care of nicely.
